title.value: Da Vinci Find Member using Patient and Coverage Resources

description.value:
The **$member-match** operation allows one Health Plan to retrieve a unique identifier for a Member from another Health Plan using a member's demographic and coverage information. The intended to use is to support sharing of prior coverage information with a new Health Plan when an enrolling member switches plans.
To request prior coverage information from another plan a new Health Plan **SHALL** submit the $member-match operation on the Patient FHIR endpoint for the old Health Plan with following resources compiled into a Parameter Resource: * `MemberPatient` (US Core Patient containing Member demographics) * `OldCoverage` (details of prior health plan coverage provided by the member, typically from their Health Plan coverage card) * `NewCoverage` (details of new or prospective health plan coverage, provided by the health plan based upon the member's enrolment)
In response, the old Health Plan **SHALL** return the following data if records for Member are found: * The unique member identifier added to the `Patient.identifier` in the Patient resource submitted by the new health plan. * The new health plan coverage resource.
(Only one Patient and one Coverage record are to be returned.)

documentation.value: Parameter submitted by the New Plan **SHALL** contain US Core Patient containing Member demographics.
Parameter submitted by the New Plan **SHALL** contain Coverage details of prior health plan coverage provided by the member, typically from their Health Plan coverage card.
Parameter submitted by the New Plan **SHALL** contain Coverage details of new or prospective health plan coverage provided by the new health plan based upon the member's enrollment.

Parameter returned by the Old Plan resource **SHALL** contain the MemberPatient resource received from New Plan with the ADDITION of an identifier of type "UMB" representing the Unique identifier identifying the member at the Old Health Plan.
Parameter returned by the Old Plan resource **SHALL** contain the NewCoverage record received from the New Plan.
